website_summaries.verdict: With a sound quality that compares favorably to most aux cables, this 3.5-millimeter model stands out for its unique cord length and compatibility with multiple devices.
pros: Mediabridge's 12-foot cable eliminates tangles and mess with just enough extra cable for the needs of most users
We also love the step-down design, which allows extra space between the grip and connector so it fits snugly in virtually every device, even when using a case
With very little noise interference, the cable provides good quality as well
cons: Some users report the cord casing may form a split near the connectors with frequent use

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptable static, do not buy unless you don't care about what your ears hear.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give a zero star rating, I would. I have static on this cable, the 8 ft model. I have swapped the cable with others I already own to test to make sure it was not interference from my setup; answer, it's this cable. I guess, it does deserve one star. It does connect to a port and it does transmit audio. The problem is that the audio is trash. I am currently repacking this item to be returned, as it is worthless to me. Did I mention the fact it doesn't work well?
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mama

customer_reviews.title: Unholy cable
customer_reviews.text: This sweet aux. cable has survived for 4 years through two cars being totaled and glass shattering all over it. If my next car is totaled we'll know for sure the cable was cursed by a very powerful factory/warehouse worker. It works perfectly and the sound quality is nice, despite the otherworldly interference occasionally whispering dark secrets. The connection is very strong and can keep a phone attached through high impacts. I can't bring myself to get rid of it (It won't let me).
customer_reviews.author: S. Mountain

customer_reviews.title: Cane in Bent and scratched.
customer_reviews.text: Heard a lot of good things about these cables so i gave them a shot. So much thicker than other replacement cables out there. However, i dont know if i was sent a used or a new product, but i paid for new and got a bent and scratched one side of the 3.5mm plug. I hope this gets noticed and will be replaced
customer_reviews.author: PDI190 Adrian

customer_reviews.title: I guess u get what you pay for.  Junk
customer_reviews.text: Barely works it has echoes when it does play sound. Crackles and has no sound. I'm not exchanging it because I'll have to pay shipping on it so I pay more because your junk doesnt work.
customer_reviews.author: Akuser47

customer_reviews.title: No more buzzing or humming static noise with this cable
customer_reviews.text: A very huge positive difference with this cable is no more humming, buzzing, static noise during the time when the song is turned off from my phone or laptop to the speaker which this cable is connected to. Just a beautiful silence. I'm happy with that! Be careful when ordering it from the Amazon page because I thought I was ordering the 12 feet and did not realize that my order got automatically switched to a 2 feet cable when I selected the lower price. I am returning it for the 12 feet, with no additional cost, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Ama

customer_reviews.title: Good quality connector cable
customer_reviews.text: This is an inexpensive audio cable with gold plated 3.5mm male plugs. It was recommended by Amazon to connect my Bose PC speakers to my PC, although it connected to an HDMI audio splitter via a two channel RCA adapter. I clicked on the deal, rather than search through a box of tangled assorted cords for one that would work. It works well. The seller takes its job seriously, sending me more customer support information than an auto maker did when I purchased a $50k pickup, really!
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Kenney

customer_reviews.title: Solid cable, though a few months of use in transit has damaged it
customer_reviews.text: Wrapping up the cable a little too hard for a month or so of back-and-forth to the office has started causing the audio to deteriorate/lose channels completely if in just the wrong position. Since this is mostly because I was too rough with the cable I'll still rate it highly, though this should be a cautionary tale for those looking for durability. Overall happy with the cable, bought a second one so I can keep one at home and one at the office, thereby reducing further damage opportunities.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Greene

customer_reviews.title: but some of us do not like being lied to
customer_reviews.text: The connectors measure 3.45mm, not 3.5mm. This is enough to make them fall out of my Vmoda M100 headphones. This product is NOT as specified. The 0.050mm difference would be meaningless to most folks, but some of us do not like being lied to. Crap product, crap manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Neutrino

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Convenient
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect wire for my iPhone 5c. I bought it for my new headphones. The strength of this wire appears to be better than the wire that came with the headphones. I also like the feature of the wire plugs that makes it easier to fit into the phone’s case. I’d recommend this to anyone wanting a strong wire for OneOdio headphones, or any others that use replaceable wires with 3.5mm plugs.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use with new, rather expensive (for me, anyway) Bose speakers, because the included cord was ridiculously short. The extra length of the Mediabridge gave me the ability to properly place the one speaker to my right, where it should be. I have purchased Mediabridge products before and have always been pleased -- this cable is no exception. Recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: Roget

customer_reviews.title: Great Cable!
customer_reviews.text: I got this 2 foot mini-jack cable for use in my truck AUX input. It in an improvement over my store bought 3 foot cable. Sound quality is definitely better and the ends fit nice and secure in the 3.5mm jacks. The 2 foot length is perfect and you don't need to worry about excess cable. There seems to be a good amount of shielding on the cable while allowing it to remain flexible. Great products from MediaBridge!
customer_reviews.author: B. Good

customer_reviews.title: a great audio cable I've ordered from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: A great audio cable I've ordered from Amazon, not to mention it comes with an affordable price tag on it! Other cables from Amazon are good as well. But over long time of usage, this is the best audio cable I've ever had from Amazon. It does not distort sound, protecting from all noises and maintains secured contact with audio devices all the time that is my point. Other cables tend to be unstable from time to time but this is different!: I love to use this one!
customer_reviews.author: Sungwook Kim

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT QUALITY CABLE
customer_reviews.text: I ONLY BUY MY AUXILIARY AUDIO CABLES FROM MEDIA BRIDGE. THEY LAST VERY LONG, HAS EXCELLENT AUDIO SOUND AND NO NOISE. THEY HAVE A VARIETY OF LENGTHS TO SUIT YOUR NEEDS. THE ENDS ARE GOLD PLATED, AND THE HOUSING IS MADE OF METAL NOT PLASTIC. SUPERIOR QUALITY TO OTHER CABLES AT THE SAME PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Mora Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Mediabridge products are higher quality
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several Mediabridge stereo cables, audio cables and adaptors. They have all met or exceeded expectations on applicable purchase criteria. Mediabridge products deliver an excellent sound signal. The appearance of product quality (aesthetic design) is important to me in installations where cables are visible. Mediabridge product aesthetics include materials and fittings for superior durability in normal and temporary installations.
customer_reviews.author: cbuckh32

customer_reviews.title: Cable adds 20+ FPS to my sound!
customer_reviews.text: Just kidding with the title! Just got this and it fits in my gaming headset and compared it to the cable that came with my headset and the difference is massive. Hopefully the shielding and thickness can help provide cleaner audio but I mostly just got it for the additional length over my stock one. It appears durable and the additional thickness makes me think it's a quality cable. I will update this review if anything changes but so far I am satisfied. Thanks Mediabridge!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: I used these plugs to plug into my cassette player that is plugged into my record player for transferring cassette tapes. The 3.5mm plugs are working perfectly and there seems to be no problem at all. I tried other plugs that did not work, but these fit right in and started working with my devices. I have not used them in any other device.
customer_reviews.author: Satisfied Customer

customer_reviews.title: One year later and still in great shape
customer_reviews.text: I generally take care of my things, so I didn't put a lot of additional/unnecessary stress on the product other than daily wear & tear. I chose to get the 2ft cable, and was initially worried it would be too short, however it was perfect... Given that I spent a solid day or two researching auxiliary cables, I am satisfied with my choice all around.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Khan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for a while
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed an AUX cable to play my own music in the car. I like that the cable is thick and the metal ends look really nice, even though they can get really hot/burning in the summer. It worked perfectly for several months before it started to get finicky. I'd have to mess around with the positioning of the wire and the plug on both ends to get sound to come through right. I wasn't ever rough with it and it never left the car, so I'm not sure why it started acting up. I thought the thicker cable would hold up better than cheap, flimsy ones. Maybe it's the extreme heat where I live?
customer_reviews.author: stellaxtine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for iphone to computer use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cord to connect my iphone to my computer so that I could record some voicemails on the computer. It works perfectly for that purpose. The cord is super sturdy and the connections are solid. The voicemail files recorded clearly. I am very happy with this purchase and glad I made the choice to buy a midrange cord instead of a 5-cent hit-or-miss option from overseas. Sometimes the super-cheap cords work and sometimes you have to buy another one, or five, to do the job. My experience with Mediabridge products to date has been excellent and I highly recommend their stuff.
customer_reviews.author: twirlgrrl

customer_reviews.title: Admittedly, an aux cable is an aux cable in ...
customer_reviews.text: Admittedly, an aux cable is an aux cable in many ways. But, this one feels well made with a slightly thicker-than-typical wire insulating sheath that resists tangling and solid-feeling ends that inspire confidence that this will be a durable product. Additionally, the "step down" ends allow for use of the cable to connect through the cut-outs on most phone and MP3 player cases without removing the case, which is very handy for me since I'm using this to connect my phone to the aux input jack in my car.
customer_reviews.author: Anthrogeneric

customer_reviews.title: NOT small enough to fit into a Mophie iPhone case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cable specifically because the reviews stated it had a small end that could fit into bulky phone cases with small openings. But it's NOT small enough to fit into a mophie battery case. I'm not sure what people are talking about when they say it's a small end, as it's pretty much exactly the same size as every other 1/8th inch audio cable out there. Very disappointed. :/ Was hoping to be able to listen to music in the car without having to take off my phone case, since I just know one of these days I'll lose the bottom half of the case if I have to keep taking it off every day. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Boyd

customer_reviews.title: it looks really nice Cons - Broke after six months of light use
customer_reviews.text: Pros - Very professional looking cable - Long and flexible - No really, it looks really nice Cons - Broke after six months of light use. The wire seemed to be broken inside somewhere, as sound would only work if I wiggled it into a precise positioning, after which any movement (or gravity) would break this intermittent connection once more. This happened during a road trip, so it was a bit inconvenient :( - The gray protecting cover easily screws off, often when you're not trying to have it screw off...
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Caveat emptor is a Latin term that means "let the buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: In this case, one should beware their own expectations. As this cable often needs to be in close proximity to a USB Quick Charge for 32-bit D to A conversion on the phone, I'll have to use it as a general mini-din cable. I had the misapprehension that for the higher cost, and ideally higher quality, that it would be shielded. Not so. My bad. For a good quality basic cable, the pricing ought to be lower and Mediabridge can forgo the pretty packaging. Cable allows intense electrical static if near a charging Quick-charge USB on the input to phone
customer_reviews.author: Rick Raymo

customer_reviews.title: Finely Machined Cable!
customer_reviews.text: This is a remarkable cable for the price. What I like: 1) The bodies of the cable heads are metal -- as opposed to the plastic generally found on cables of this type. Good quality, and won't split. 2) Nice sleeves extend from the cable head onto the cable itself, a nice way to prevent cable failure where the head joins the cable. 3) It's beautiful, with a slightly greater "heft" than other's I've had due to more metal. Very nice finish, like I'd expect form something much more expensive. 4) Audio quality is GREAT! In all, I'd recommend purchasing one! I love mine.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: great quality and works great
customer_reviews.text: the quality of this cable seems very high. the connections themselves and thickness of the cable are nicer and feel better opposed to most cables you find out there. i finally had a chance to use it this weekend for 3 days and i didnt notice any white noise or hissing when using my phone with the rental car. the length is long enough that you can connect it up front and a passenger in the rear seat can reach it without stretching too much. so far im very pleased with the cable and hope to get a lot of use from it since i rent cars frequently for my work and some dont have bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: Darkknightt

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality great price.
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this to replace my old Griffin code that died after 10 years. I did research and this brand always showed up in the top 3. I've only used it a few times and I'm satisfied with the sound quality. The sound doesn't seem to resonate the same as my old Griffin cord but it works well. Hopefully it will last as long.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Monteiro

customer_reviews.title: These seem like good quality cables, so far.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a longer cord for my Bose Companion 2 speakers (which I love). These seem like quality cables. 4 out of 5 stars until I see how long they last. But I'm more than satisfied right now. The audio quality seems the same as the included speaker cable.
customer_reviews.author: L. Graves

customer_reviews.title: Working
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and is working as it should out of the package. Love the stepped design that makes is easy to use with my phone case on. Should't they all be made this way by now? Can't speak to durability/quality over time yet but if something comes up I'll post an update. For now 5 stars seems in order.
customer_reviews.author: Hondonian Rebel

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just bought 3 of these. Really good for the price, not to long, not to short. One of the cables is bad. When you plug it in, sound doesn't work and when I plug it into an audio splitter, it cuts out the sound of all the other items hooked up to it. The other 2 cables work great. but I had purchased 1 extra since they were cheap. Still even with one bad cable, its a good product. note: I did not contact seller to swap out the cable. Just wanted to add that as I didnt want to imply bad customer service. My package arrived on time and everything else as advertised
customer_reviews.author: Donnie J. Dennison

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable aux cable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cord after having multiple longer and retractable cords fail on me. I thought the shorter and slightly more durable cord would prevent damage and hopefully last a long time. I was correct. I've had zero issues using this cord to connect my phone to my car stereo like with past products. No tangles, pinched or bent cable, or bad connections. I don't recommend buying this product if you think you'll want people in your back seat to be able to reach the device connected to the stereo. I don't usually have that problem, so it's perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: Justin W

customer_reviews.title: They Do the Job
customer_reviews.text: To my surprise this cable blocks radio interference. I substituted my old desktop speaker cables with these cables and cut out interference I was getting from nearby electronics.
customer_reviews.author: SylvanDweller

customer_reviews.title: 6 years later and still working like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cable back in 2013 and have never developed any issues. The sound is great and the cable does not have any kinks (though it should considering how many times I've accidentally slammed my car door on this, yikes)!! Keeping my review short because there's not much else to say aside from it being a fantastic purchase UPDATE: After I wrote this review, my aux cord decided to kick the can. NOT TO FEAR THOUGH, I will be purchasing another one. This aux cord is too good to be changing to a new one. Highly recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for the Price!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely THE best value for this type of product. This is a larger gauge, very well constructed cable that allowed me to use my bluetooth headphones on an airplane. It appears to be very durable and has survived where skinny/flimsy wires have torn/broken. I am thoroughly impressed and absolutely recommend this to anybody in need of this type of cord. By the way I paid full price for this and am giving this review and not because someone gave it to me "for my consideration", with that said if anybody wants to send me free stuff to review I'm not gonna say no. Sorry I lose focus very quickly(squirrel).
customer_reviews.author: scott g mahar

customer_reviews.title: That's one impressive cable.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not the sort to get excited by a cable, but this one really is much nicer than the typical stereo-mini-both-ends cable. The step-down design works in all my iWhatevers and other doodads. The cord is beefy enough that it doesn't seem in danger of breaking near the plug housing like so many others do. I'm not sure whether it sounds better than others -- it's not like I'm running high quality audio over it -- but it sounds just fine. I'd but it again, but I'm not sure I'll need to since I think it'll outlast my need for such things.
customer_reviews.author: me-not-my-employer

customer_reviews.title: Cable fit both cell phone and stereo receiver on hot spa flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I bought 8 foot cable to reach audio output of Hot Spa and connect to cell phone. Worked fabulously with no connection issues or loss of volume due to length of wire. The wire is very pliable which will be good if and when it gets wet and is cold outside. The quality of construction is impressive and looks to be fine quality.
customer_reviews.author: j merr

customer_reviews.title: Mediabridge Products - reliable and well constructed
customer_reviews.text: I've bought other Mediabridge cables in the past and have been very pleased with the quality, build, and price. I was using an older 6" 3.5mm male to 3.5 mm male cable to connect the headphone output from several devices to the input on a portable headphone amp (the mightly little PA2V2 by electric-avenue). When that started developing issues, I purchased this Mediabridge (2') to replace it. As others have posted, it is well constructed and provides a firm connection, but not so tight that it requires too much force to insert or remove. The cable is thick, yet compliant. Sound quality is very good as well, I couldn't detect any 'colorization' as is often the case with cheap cables.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Well? What is there to say about a simple cable that works exactly like a cable should? This one is perfect, but so are all the others. Come to think of it, I was exactly the length that was advertised,so that must count for something, too.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and very durable! Thick cord!
customer_reviews.text: I just received them through the mail last night and surprisingly, they look very durable. The cord is quite thick too! The ends come with covers so you don't want to lose that for they will protect the tips of the cord. They work great for all my speakers, my headphones with detachable cords such as the "Skullcandy Hesh 2.0" They work fantastic. There is no complications at all. I highly recommend these because they look like they will last you a long time. I would update this review after a few months to see how they take my abuse. Other than that, I am very happy with this purchase and do recommend it :)
customer_reviews.author: Le Alaquen

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect...
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought two audio cables, one was mediabridge, the other protronix. Both are made well but the sound quality of the mediabridge was by FAR superior. I listen to headphones at work eight hours a day and have bought many male to male cables. I know mediabridge guarantees them for a year, but frankly I'll be happy if I get six months. If I get at least six months out of this cable, I would definitely purchase more. The reason I say almost perfect is I would prefer an L shaped connection with volume controls.To my knowledge they do not have one. Beyond that minor imperfection, I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: k-redd

customer_reviews.title: Mediabridge does again a great job
customer_reviews.text: The product came exactly as described and on time via Amazon Prime in one of their easy open boxes. Unlike a lot of smaller cable lengths and makes, this product appears to be a sturdy well made cable with the typical male to male endings. The outer cable is flexible enough and doesn't appear "fragile." The cable to male endings is secure and this is important as it is often where such cables are most vulnerable. I tested the cable out between an iPhone and an aux input on my car and all is well. If you are asking, yes I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Phrehdd

customer_reviews.title: Just the right length; great fit.
customer_reviews.text: We have a car that hasn't been removed of its humble factory accessories. We have to plug our phones into the AUX input in order to play YouTube or iTunes through the cars' speakers. This cord fits very snuggly in our car's AUX input and is just the perfect length; our phone rests comfortably in its small compartment next to the shift without the cord dangling or getting in the way. The quality of the cord itself is very nice, exemplified by its nice fit. No cutting in/out of sound, static, etc. like you get with cords of lesser quality. We've had terrible cords in the past so having this one is a welcomed relief.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: good cable.
customer_reviews.text: I bought a different, cheaper cable thinking, "How could you possibly screw up something so simple as an audio cable." But I had no idea... Within a few weeks there was like a hissing over the audio (I wasn't even playing loud music), that would be worse depending on how you oriented the cable... It became useless because the hissing was so grating on my ears... So I bought THIS cable. My first impression was that it felt sturdier and very well made. And there is no hissing, even after some heavy use. I should have bought this one in the first place. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: emmi

customer_reviews.title: Works great and didn't cost a fortune!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cable to use with a cellphone that had an FM receiver built in but needed a "headphone" to pick up the connection. Well we hooked this up to my wireless Bluetooth speaker that has a 3.5mm input jack built in. It worked flawlessly and sounded great. 12 feet is a pretty long cable, but it feels well built. It's not stiff but it doesn't feel like it's a flimsy piece of crap. I've bought mediabridge cables before, and all of their products I've experienced have worked great for me at first, but some of their USB cables have flaked out on my sister. So I'm hoping this cable will hold up to the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Slightly cheaper feeling
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this exact cable about a year ago, and loved it. It was the perfect length, had high quality connectors, and the cable felt nice and thick. I needed to replace the cable recently because I forgot to take it out of the car that I was selling. The replacement that I ordered felt noticeably flimsier and thinner. I have ordered many cables from mediabridge in the past and they have all been excellent. This is the first time I ordered a cable from them and thought that it was just "OK". Maybe they are trying to cut some costs here and there, but I definitely noticed a different in quality.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty aux cable
customer_reviews.text: Thick gauge wire, seems like excellent shielding. I have had auxiliary input cables transfer electrical interference from my phone charger to the truck's speakers. Not this one. I bought two, knowing I would eventually lose one.
customer_reviews.author: Mature Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY HIGH QUALITY CABLE/CORD
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to connect a recently purchased Sony CD Walkman player to a Blackstar recording/modeling amplifier which uses a 3.5mm stereo signal in connection, and mini-USB out as a composite back to my computer. I can take basic tracks burned on a CD and play along on another instrument to overdub and record to build complex multi-track recording projects. Cable quality is excellent, well shielded, and the connectors are excellent gold-plated mini-TRS. Decent price and fast shipping. I even got a follow-up email from the company advertising their range of products and offering any technical advice for assembling products for certain needs.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: I CAN FIGURE OUT THE ELECTRONIC WORLD !
customer_reviews.text: SO HAPPY I TOOK THE CHANCE AND PURCHASED THIS AUDIO CABLE...I RECENTLY BOUGHT A USED CAR WITH A BRAND NEW STEREO BY PIONEER WITH AN ATTACHMENT FOR AN MP3 PLAYER....AND I HAD ALMOST THREE MONTHS OF HELP FROM APPLE TO TEACH ME HOW TO DOWNLOAD!! SO,YOU CAN TELL I AM NOT TECHNICALLY SAVVY....THIS CABLE FIT MY MP3 AND I CROSSED MY FINGERS AS I WENT TO MY STEREO...AND BAM!!! IT WORKED....WEEEEEE! NOW I CAN LISTEN TO ALL THE SONGS I WANT TO WHILE DRIVING MY "NEW" CAR...AGAIN...THANK YOU AMAZON....
customer_reviews.author: MARSOC MOM

customer_reviews.title: Great for cell phones with cases
customer_reviews.text: I have tried out quite a few random branded 3.5mm audio cables in the past few years and this one is now my favorite and go to brand now. I like these because the shape of the end allows them to easily plug into a cell phone with a case on. If you have ever had to remove your case just to plug in an audio cable, consider this cable. I've never had any of these go bad where they lose stereo because of a severed cable connection inside the wire/connection head like many other cheapy cables, so that is a plus as well. I would recommend this cable, especially for cell phones with cases!
customer_reviews.author: Techno T

customer_reviews.title: Great sound
customer_reviews.text: I got these to play my iPod in my truck, the previous cheapo cords that I was using were producing fallout and disconnects with really poor audio quality. These audio cords are excellent and are giving me that sound quality that I need —i bought a second longer one
customer_reviews.author: Snotter

customer_reviews.title: Good plug
customer_reviews.text: Using this plug all day. Has held up really well.
customer_reviews.author: James Mann

customer_reviews.title: Easy way to set up your iPod, iPhone, to play on any other device.
customer_reviews.text: The other cable I had for 8 years finally gave up. Well, now this is my go-to. Brilling and simple. Works just as advertised. I have no trouble with this at all. I got tired of the one disc at a time in my car, and wanted a longer, and varied playlist. Easy! Plug this in to my iPod and I have tunes long enough for the entire trip and I can pay ALL my attention to the road, which is how it should be. This is also a boon to playing a long set when in the garage on my boom box, or out in the yard. Wonderful, Get this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Price

customer_reviews.title: A high build quality cable that helped solve an annoying audio problem.
customer_reviews.text: For a while I couldn't figure out why my THX sound system speakers would hum when receiving audio output from my PS4 game controller's handset. When I replaced my ten year old audio cable with this product, the hum vanished. Silence became golden and I became a fan of MediaBridge. I really do like this audio cable with its gold plated connectors and a solid build quality. I also appreciated the fact that once I ordered, the company emailed me contact information in case I needed technical support or just had questions in advance of its arrival. That was a thoughtful touch, something more companies emulate. In short, I recommend the product and its vendor.
customer_reviews.author: David Elliott Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good price, sturdy looking cable
customer_reviews.text: With my older vehicle I need to have a way to listen to music/podcasts/GPS on my phone through the radio system, so this solves that problem. My old cord had a problem with one of the jacks being frayed so I had to wiggle and turn the jack to get sound to both speakers. This cable should solve that problem for a small price. I was looking to repair my old male-to-male jack, but realized it is cheaper to buy this cable. I'll update this after a few years or until it wears out (hopefully not too soon). The cable seems thick enough and in general pretty good quality for 4.99.
customer_reviews.author: Dchon

customer_reviews.title: worked 6 years in my car
customer_reviews.text: My Amazon history shows me I had this cable in service for 6 years (!) in my vehicle. It was recently the only thing stolen when my car was ransacked 'cause I left it unlocked. So this thing went through 6 years of Minnesota winters, which means constant temp fluctuations -50F to 100F over the year. Never found a phone it didn't slip right into and the cable never cracked or showed signs of wear. I bought three more! very good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Marigold

customer_reviews.title: Not quite 3.5mm, but works nonetheless.
customer_reviews.text: Like someone mentioned before, the cable measures a bit smaller than 3.5mm. So, when I use it, it fits well for one device, but is loose for the other device I have it plugged into. The sound works well enough. I have not experienced any static so far.
customer_reviews.author: Leilani T

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting a connection in narrow equipment case openings
customer_reviews.text: OK so if you have some of the newer iPad, iPod, iPhone whatever cases you may have run into the issue where the standard headphone cable just won't fit. You have to either slice the plastic (& hopefully not your fingers) around the tip to snug into the hole to get a good connection, or find something like this. The thin profile is perfect for going into those tight audio openings in cases or other equipment. Well made, I've been using these a while with no broken wiring. I carry a set in my backpack to use with my portable speaker & iPhone & iPad on the road. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: firewallbillTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great cable
customer_reviews.text: Great aux cable at this price point, feels heavy duty. The cable sheathing is thick, but flexible, so must be high strand count inside. The connectors feel heavy duty, and like they won't break after 2 days of use. They neck down at the connection point though, so if trying to use it with conjunction of a cell phone case that has a narrow opening, this will work. I looked at it and was reminded of one of those high end cables from the manufacturer that shares a name with a popular energy drink, at an affordable price point.
customer_reviews.author: crexor

customer_reviews.title: the cable seems cool and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, the cable seems cool and sturdy. Not to mention, the jack design allows you to use it without taking off your phone's case (in some cases). However, like every other aux cable, this one only worked for a little while before becoming inop, the only issue was that I paid significantly less for the other cables! Basically, you are paying more money here for a better looking product that lasts just as long as its cheaper counterparts, which is why I would recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Ghani Memon

customer_reviews.title: Top quality
customer_reviews.text: First, I'm happy to support Mediabridge because they seem to genuinely care about their product and their customers. They send an email after each purchase, promising to make right any problem with their product, and based on other stories in these reviews, I believe them. The cable is as high quality as I've found (surpassing high-priced items by Monster). The cable is thick, the connections are solid (especially the ever-important 1/8" jack to cable connection that often frays), and I see it lasting many years.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Good enough deal...Above average quality...
customer_reviews.text: STURDY. You can't go wrong with ANYTHING from Mediabridge THAT has been my experience CONSISTENTLY, for a few years running now. GREAT service, GREAT prices, NO I don't receive any additional compensation besides reliable products from this company (AND Amazon.) Great team. Hard to match leave alone do better. NO, it wasn't EXACTLY what I expected in terms of the cables actual exterior texture, but it will do the job and serve it's purpose in a high quality way. The exterior is kind of 'plasic-ky' but flexible enough, stronger than the standard cables that come packaged with electronics. Great deal. Priced lower than braided types.
customer_reviews.author: William F. Nappi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product by Mediabridge
customer_reviews.text: The 3.5 mm Male to 3.5 mm Male Stereo Audio Cable by Mediabridge was delivered in timely fashion and was well packaged but the performance of the Stereo Audio Cable has been excellent.I use the cable to hook up to a Stereo Cassette Player to the Computer to convert Tapes to MP3's.The 8 foot length is perfect for the Cassette Player- Computer hookup being long enough to have plenty of room to move The Cable easily but not to long to get tangled up plus the audio from the Cable after the MP3 conversion is excellent.I will be looking at more Mediabridge products if needed because of the 5 star performance of Mediabridge and its 3.5 mm Stereo Audio Cable.
customer_reviews.author: mayorange

customer_reviews.title: Redbridge HDMI Cables
customer_reviews.text: I have bought well over 15 HDMI cables and assorted cable accompaniments from Mediabridge over the years and have never had to send any back or replace one. I have placed them in walls etc with no problems. 4k, no problem. I would and have recommended them to many people. You will not regret this purchase unless you buy the wrong size.
customer_reviews.author: Animal Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I use Mediabridge for all my cabling needs. The prices are extremely affordable and the products are always extremely high quality. You can tell the difference between this aux cable and other cheap ones you find at the gas station or in your friends car. The cable shielding is thick but still flexible, the metal tips are solid and they connect securely to a 3.5mm port. I am a huge fan of this cable and this company!
customer_reviews.author: Peter Centner

customer_reviews.title: Full shielding blocks noise from car alternator
customer_reviews.text: I connected my phone to the AUX input on my car. OTHER cables picked up noise from the car alternator. THIS cable blocked out ALL interference from the car alternator and other electronics.
customer_reviews.author: Synergistic One

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Cable
customer_reviews.text: Very very nice quality! I wanted a really short cable and 2 feet was the shortest I could find. I use this for my radio in the bathroom to hook up my phone for Pandora. Works great and is a very nice cable compared to ones I've owned before. The quality it nice and it comes with a cap for the ends which was great for me since my radio is on the counter, I can use the cap to protect it from any water splashing on it. It goes in smooth and comes out smooth and the design and quality is higher that I expected.
customer_reviews.author: GraceTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and budget friendly aux cord (for car)
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this item at least three times now. The aux cord will last a few years in my car before I have to buy a new one. It is worth the price and quality every time. The sound is great.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: This cable is shielded thus it does not act like an antenna picking up the AC line noise
customer_reviews.text: I have a small vacuum tube headphone amplifier that was injecting a hum into the headphones. I was wondering if it might have something to do with the cable going from the source to the amp and that is what in fact turned out to be the problem. This cable is shielded thus it does not act like an antenna picking up the AC line noise. It is rather strange that I did not have a problem with my solid state amp though. Whatever, it worked and I am, no longer having to deal with the issue. Thank you Mediabridge !
customer_reviews.author: gadhar mhaighstir

customer_reviews.title: Works Great. Successfully hooked up my sound bar to my HDTV.
customer_reviews.text: Worked wonderfully hooking my LG sound bar to my Vizio HDTV. The audio is clear and crisp and sounds great. The plug fits securely into my sound bar and TV and doesn't pop or crackle when being adjusted. The cable itself feels very durable and slightly rigid, which could be a result of the rubber coating on the wire. I actually prefer this to smaller more flexible cables that tend to break or fray due to a lack of protection. This is your basic 3.5mm auxiliary cable and works as intended. The 4ft size is great for a car or a home audio system.
customer_reviews.author: R. Borgeous

customer_reviews.title: Mediabridge Goes the Extra Mile!
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong buying Mediabridge for all your electrical needs! They are always about quality. I received mine with the protective caps for the male ends!!
customer_reviews.author: sweetsixteen

customer_reviews.title: These are not a compromise in quality, but the are reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these of various lengths and I am happy with them all. I use one of these as a patch cable from my usb DAC into the pre amp and I use them as inputs from smartphones and computers. I have audio equipment in my media room, the bedroom, and the garage. I have come to trust cables from Mediabridge and I look for them whenever I need one for a specific application. The quality to price ratio is the biggest selling point for me. These are not a compromise in quality, but they are reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cable so that I could hook my iPhone up to my car stereo to listen to it. I've had it for six months now, with everyday use, and it has held up great. The last cable I bought was a different brand and stopped working after just a few months of use. I've been very pleased with this cable. The cable is fairly short, though, at just two feet, but it works out well for our car, because I don't want a bunch of extra cable floating around. Would definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: K. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Good cable and the price is right.
customer_reviews.text: Good cable. It has a good clean sound. As of now I have to give it 5 stars. It's well made but in my experience with aux cables they always break down in due time. I need to see how it lasts in the long run. But as of now I'm happy with my cable and it exceeds my expectations. For the price it's well worth it. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: G.S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, best price!
customer_reviews.text: Very flexible yet strong cord. Great audio quality. Use this for my PC onboard Realtek HD audio to my Altec Lansing amplified speakers. Fast shipping and great packing. Highly recommended this product and company.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Golden
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert technician of audio systems; however, I will go out on a limb and say that these do not seem to lose signal across the line. I connect this from my mp3 device to Bose speakers and it sounds much better than other cables I have purchased in the past. You want to make sure that you do not roll this cable up to tight if you ever have to store it. The sleeve very thick. I have a feeling that this cable is going to last much longer than the manufacturer guarantees seeing that I never have to roll or move it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Savage

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as they look
customer_reviews.text: I was initially impressed with the look of the cable, but after some use it has developed a connection problem at the ends. Swapping out for a different cable fixed the concern. Seems a little loose in the audio jack compared to another cable. Perhaps the ends are a little undersized? I will try another brand.
customer_reviews.author: mr.octane

customer_reviews.title: Failed after less than a month of use.
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Mediabridge HDMI cables before and was impressed with their quality. So when I needed a good 3.5mm audio cable, I bought this one. My original review for this product was 5 stars. But just hours after giving it a 5 star review. The cable went bad. It now has a loose connection even though I've treated it well and have had it for less than a month. Maybe I can get an exchange. If so, I'll update this review with a new rating for the replacement cable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris A. Kantack

customer_reviews.title: Line noise
customer_reviews.text: This cable has significant line noise when used from PC to gaming headset mixamp. When it is removed, all noise is 100% gone. Disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old cord, this one works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the headphone line on the noise reduction headphones I wear while mowing the lawn and clearing snow from the driveway. The prior cord would cause static distortion or lose connection at the slightest movement or vibration (I assume the connection was loose). The replacement works perfectly and it a tight fit. It's a much thicker cable than my old one and I expect it will be quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Simkow

customer_reviews.title: Never buying another brand again.
customer_reviews.text: This cord already has stellar reviews, so I just want to commend mediabridge on their outstanding product quality. This cord is sturdy, thick and durable - there is no way its breaking anytime soon. The cord blew my expectations for $8, but what really got me is that mediabridge sent me two emails confirming that I received my order, thanking me for my order, and checking in to make sure my product was performing up to standards. I was beyond impressed at their customer service and quality control procedures. This is the kind of company that does it right, and they have secured my $$$ for goods like this in the future :)
customer_reviews.author: Nightsong

customer_reviews.title: Solid cable
customer_reviews.text: It's a good price for a good product. This 3.5mm cable comes in crystal clear. Some of the cheaper cables I've used in the past have a buzzing sound when playing via the aux port in my car, not this one. The cable feels heavy duty and is really long in length - almost too long! I used my very frequently for two months before it stopped working but that was my fault for accidentally closing the car door on it - now you see my reason for saying it's almost too long! It really is a great cable at a good price and I'm likely going to be purchasing another as a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissie L

customer_reviews.title: audio cable
customer_reviews.text: Hi! recently bought one of your cables thru Amazon, (male to male audio 3.5mm) and bought another for an extra, from another company, as it was in red. These i use from device to headphones. If you have ever looked at exotic stereo eqiupment priced in the stratosphere, you may note that the price of the connecting cables is ridiculous. Yes, ridiculous. Therefore I concluded that there is little real significance in these cables for hundreds of dollars/ft. I was and am amazed at the difference. Yours is very noticeably better, louder and clearer. Even though the two cables purchased were very affordable and similar(low priced) the difference was really something. Thanks for a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Perkins

customer_reviews.title: I can finally hear!!!
customer_reviews.text: I needed an aux cable to plug my android phone into my vehicle audio system in my personal vehicle as well as my work truck. This did the job and seems to be well made. It has a heavy feel to it and the male plug ends fit snug without any play, and the length is perfect for either vehicle I use this in. Lets me use my phone through the audio system for hands free communications while driving. Works well for my android phone when streaming from internet radio apps as well as music from android device when plugged into audio system. Extremely happy with product. thanks Amazon for another excellent product and service.
customer_reviews.author: GSD

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Alright, I have bought cables in the past from many sources. I bought this one to use with a radio and my MP3 player or my phone and I have to say I was impressed. Sound is fine--I don't think you will notice any issues with that and your interconnects until you spend thousands of dollars on your sound equipment. However, this cable is really impressive based on cost and the apparent quality of the cable. It is heavy cable with beefy plugs that give it an overall feeling of high quality. I feel like this is a piece of equipment that will be around for a while based on that feeling of quality.
customer_reviews.author: 31Alpha

customer_reviews.title: Great Bang for Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: Way better than paying $10-$15+ at Radio Shack or Bestbuy. These work flawlessly; I still have them years later. The sound quality is great, and anyone who says they don't sound great must have gotten a horrible pair. I have been using these for quite some time now and have no qualms. I use these for my home theater system (laptop connected to tv and speakers) and have had no issues. Shipment was fast and simple (like most other Amazon orders) and packaging was safe and secure. Can't say too much more as this was a simple purchase for a simple use case.
customer_reviews.author: Good life

customer_reviews.title: Failing after a few months of light use
customer_reviews.text: Cable worked well for a while but has begun to crap out. Signal is intermittent based upon placement, signaling that the wiring is wearing thin inside. Too bad, it worked so well before, fitting into my phone case and everything. I haven't even used it that much.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: This Aux Cable is the best, one word 'consistency'.
customer_reviews.text: My friend use to this white flat aux cable and its just terrible. He had to keep his phone and the cord in a certain position while he was driving. Guess what happened when he turned, the phone went slightly out of position. So only one side of the car played music, he had to adjust it while he was driving it was hilarious. Plus it was too long like 6FT I've had this cord for a year now and it does what its suppose to you get in the car plug it into the phone and it plays every single time No Lag. My friend has this one too now after he saw how good it performed.
customer_reviews.author: Rell

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product based on the great reviews, and even so, I was blown away at the quality of the cable and customer service! Mediabridge contacted me to let me know the order had shipped, and then again after a while to ask me to review the product and remind me of their contact info if I lost it. The quality of the cable is excellent! Very slim aluminum clad gold plated connectors and solid but flexible, thick, high quality wire. I did not expect this high of quality at this price point, even despite the reviews!
customer_reviews.author: Schlotzky

customer_reviews.title: Nicely constructed
customer_reviews.text: We have all had the really poorly constructed cable of this type. Look no further. This cable is better than all others of this type I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Stepped plug fits into phones wearing most cases.
customer_reviews.text: This isn't the first time I've purchased Mediabridge products and it won't be the last. As expected these 4 foot cables are well built and feel like good quality. The rubber sleeving on the cables feels soft in the hand and does not tangle easily. These plug into my Note4 in a Tech21 and a Speck case. The plug is stepped so it should fit into most cases. I have been using 2 of their longer aux cables just like these for a few years now and have had no issues with them. I expect the same from these. I also use their Cat5e cable. Also excellent quality.
customer_reviews.author: Terrapin88

customer_reviews.title: A High Quality Cable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace a cheap cable I was using to connect my phone to the AUX input in my car. The cheap cable was picking up all kinds of EMI, I couldn't enjoy my music. This cable does a really good job of filtering it all out, and it even provides a crisper sound. The build is nice - a thick cable with plenty of relief, seems solid. All in all, a great cable.
customer_reviews.author: David-and-Chaslin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Iphone cases
customer_reviews.text: The Mediabridge product is a well built cable with a solid feel. But what makes it great is that it has an extended collar that lets it fit easily into Lifeproof and Otter box style cases. Many cables are too short for this and won't connect enough for the device to switch to the headphone output. As a techie in the professional sound and PA industry, I frequently test stuff with music from my phone. With this cable you won't have to disassemble the case to get a solid connection. In my Mustang, it makes a great connection with the Ford's mini jack and my Otterbox'ed phone. Build quality Effective design Nice price what's not to love??
customer_reviews.author: jdroadie

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected, looks nice as a bonus
customer_reviews.text: The audio cable works exactly as expected, but I've been pleasantly surprised by how much I like the appearance of the metal plug-casings. The stress-relief rubber that pokes out of each plug-casing is rather short, but given the thickness of the cable it's probably just fine. The only reason I didn't give this cable 5-stars is because the cable itself has grey text printed along its entire length. It's blatant advertising for mediabridge (URL and all), which I find annoying when they managed to make all other aspects so clean in appearance (almost apple-like).
customer_reviews.author: Austin Spafford

customer_reviews.title: High quality 3.5mm audio cable!
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality craftsmanship on this audio cable. I have purchased other 3.5mm audio cables in the past, and clearly they did not work out (hence my reason for purchasing this specific one). The previous ones I have tried either the ends got bent, the cable wore out (strayed wires), or simply the "connection" was not clear enough (even after pushing the cable head end hard into the stereo/device). This cable even feels high quality with the very thick shielding. I have used it for about a month now multiple times and it has held up very well.
customer_reviews.author: Jeomite

customer_reviews.title: Superior delivery and construction.
customer_reviews.text: These are fine, sturdy products and this is an excellent amazon Seller. I would have given them Five Stars had it not been that the first one I bought failed. It was not the construction rather it was giving a fuzzy midrange, and I am not sure about the warranty so I just bought new. I hope that his was lasts longer, the one that failed lasted less than a year but more than six months, so I have a back-up this time I got two.
customer_reviews.author: KeyWestMike

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, quality cable
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed by the quality of this cable. The ends are built tough, yet slim enough to fit through every phone case I have- no matter how much the case may have tried to limit access to the jack. The entire cable has a healthy heft to it and the body is sturdy, but not too stiff. Best of all, the price won't break the bank. Oh, and I almost forgot- the company emailed me shortly after purchase, with information about how to get in touch with them if I had any problems with the product. I haven't needed to contact the company, but it's very nice to know that they stand behind their products.
customer_reviews.author: Amozarte

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the cost.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to pay $10 (sale at the time) for something as simple as an AUX cable but after receiving and looking at this cable I believe it was more than worth it. The cable is thin but made with high quality cabling so it will last a very long time and the connectors are gold plated for improved conductivity to send any signal you give it. I use this in my car to listen to my songs and both the clarity of the music and how deep my subs kick now actually improved compared to my old cables and I'm sure I'll be using this cable for a really long time. 10/10.
customer_reviews.author: Garet Helmken

customer_reviews.title: Great cable, 2 feet is a little short
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to place in the aux output of my car. Given that the aux output is inside my center console next to the driver's seat I didn't believe that a cable longer than 2 ft. would be necessary. However, I should have gone with the longer cable. While the 2 ft. cable is certainly long enough to sit next to me it feels a little constrained and doesn't allow much give to adjust my device. In terms of the overall quality of the item I'm a big fan of Mediabridge products. They are consistently reliable, well constructed, and perform as expected. I would absolutely recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be a fine cable, but I needed a slim profile jacket, and the description gave me that impression.
customer_reviews.text: Only 3 stars because I bought it specifically based on the STEP DOWN DESIGN description. The jacket is just as fat as any other one out there, but metallic, so there is no give if you have to try to put it in a tight spot. The cable itself seems fine, based on appearance only. I would try to send it back, but it wouldn't be worth it, and I'm sure that eventually I can find a use for it, just not what I thought I was buying it for.
customer_reviews.author: MeisterB

customer_reviews.title: Does what any 3.5mm cable should do, with no problems
customer_reviews.text: This works just as well as any other 3.5mm Male to Male cable should. I have used this product with my microphone/headset to connect to my PC, in my car, and even for my speakers. I haven't had any problems while using this product and I can highly recommend this to anyone who would need it for connecting their phone to their car via auxiliary port, or anyone who would just need a spare 3.5mm male to male cable,
customer_reviews.author: The Shadow Warrior

customer_reviews.title: Lasted almost a year
customer_reviews.text: Most aux cables I’ve bought prior to this one lasted at max 3-4 months, due to the abuse it receives from sitting in my car in the Florida heat. This one finally bit the dust after almost a full year of use, and for the price, it’s very much worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Mediabridge 3.5mm Male to Male Stereo Audio Cable (12 Feet) - Step Down Design - (Part# MPC-35-12)
product_meta.description: Color:12 FeetMediabridge 3.5mm stereo audio cable connect & play music from your smartphone, tablet & MP3 player to a car stereo, portable speaker or other 3.5mm stereo audio output. This cable supports devices containing a standard 3.5mm auxiliary jack, which are commonly associated with headphones/ear buds. Many of today's audio components have this input for easy hookups. Unlike wireless transmitters & cassette adapters, it provides a direct wired connection that's free of static/FM interference. Dual-shielding, polished metal molding & corrosion-resistant gold-plated plugs deliver crisp sounds & minimal signal loss. A compact, Beveled step-down design gives a firmly secure connection, even when bulky cases are on your device. You can even charge your devices while in use (separate cable required). you're just a plug-in away from rocking out to your music, listening to a movie or relaxing to an audio-book. Product Features - connects & plays music from 3.5Mm-enabled devices to a car stereo/speaker - flexible jacket that's ideal for tight spaces - Dual-shielding, polished metal molding & corrosion-resistant gold-plated plugs - Beveled step-down design for a secure connection, even with bulky cases like Otterbox specifications - left connector type: 3.5 mm - left connector Gender: male - right connector type: 3.5 mm - right connector Gender: male compatibility devices with 3.5mm audio jacks, like a smartphone (iPhone), tablet (iPad), MP3 player (iPod), car stereo & portable speaker installation plug-&-play: ready to use, once each end is connected to its respective port on a compatible device notes audio is transmitted in stereo format, for a surround sound experience
feature_bullets: STEP DOWN DESIGN: Accommodates SmartPhones & MP3 cases allowing plugs to be fully seated even when bulky protective cases are used.
COMPATIBILITY: This 3.5mm (1/8 in) Cable is compatible with any brand MP3 player, phone, tablet, etc. that has a 3.5mm audio jack (aux port). NOT COMPATIBLE with microphone or video function.
BUILD: Dual Shielded Premium Quality MP3 Cable with High Quality Polished Metal Connectors with Gold Plated 3.5mm audio plugs.
MOST USED FOR: Ideal for connecting iPods, iPhones or Media Players to car stereos or speakers.
ALSO AVAILABLE IN: 2FT (Amazon Part# B005UNFRU0), 4FT (B004LTEUDO), 8FT (B004LU1U2M), 12FT (B00CTUUA5Y) & Right Angle (B00OV41ZJG)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars7,210 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
